did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Hoover Institution on War, Revolution, and Peace

did.abstract: Speeches and writings, correspondence, and printed matter, relating to the Russian émigré organizations Predstavitel'stvo Rossiiskikh 'Emigrantov v Amerike and Rossiiskoe Obshche-natsional'noe Ob"edinenie v San Frantsisko.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Konstantin P. Barskii Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

altformavail.head: Location of Originals
altformavail.p: Originals in: Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Russian émigré in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The papers in this collection reflect Barskii's activities as a leading member and activist in two émigré Russian organizations, 1949-1969. They detail the structure, goals and activities of these organizations, which were primarily involved in anti-Communist propaganda activities.

Detailed processing and preservation microfilming of these materials were made possible by a generous grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities and by matching funds from the Hoover Institution and the Museum of Russian Culture. The grant also provides depositing a microfilm copy in the Hoover Institution Archives. The original papers are held in the Museum of Russian Culture, San Francisco, as its property. A transfer table indicating corresponding box and reel numbers is available at the Hoover Institution Archives.

The Hoover Institution assumes all responsibility for notifying users that they must comply with the copyright law of the United States (Title 17 United States Code) and Hoover Rules for the Use and Reproduction of Archival Materials.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the repository's online public access catalog.

controlaccess.head: Subjects
controlaccess.subject: Russians--United States.
controlaccess.corpname: Rossiiskoe obshche-natsional'noe ob"edinenie v San Frantsisko.

did.unittitle: "Nieskol'ko slov o vseobshchem ob"edinenii Russkago Emigrantskago Studenchestva," n.d.

scopecontent.p: Typescript. Includes typed English abstract, entitled "Russian Students Abroad," n.d.

did.unittitle: Untitled report on the activities of the Russian National Student Society in Seattle, Washington, 1924 December 3.
Predstavitel'stvo Rossiiskikh Emigrantov V Amerike (Russian Immigrants' Representative Association in American Inc.) File, 1949-1968.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, leaflets, broadsides and other printed matter, as well as internal memoranda, minutes and other records related to Barskii's activities in the organization

Records consist mainly of correspondence with members of this organization and other Russian émigré organizations, leaflets, broadsides and other printed matter, as well as internal memoranda, minutes and other documents

did.unittitle: Rossiiskoe Obshche-Natsional'noe Ob"edinenie V San Frantsisko File, 1950-1969.

scopecontent.p: Clippings, correspondence, speeches, brochures, and other printed matter reflecting Barskii's activities as head of this organization

did.unittitle: Russian Center (Russkii Tsentr), San Francisco, California, 1939-1966.

scopecontent.p: Clippings, correspondence, memoranda, minutes, printed matter, reports, and writings relating to this organization
